identificationModule.briefTitle: Validation of a Brain-Computer Interface for Stroke Neurological Upper Limb Rehabilitation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Validation of a Brain-Computer Interface for Neurorehabilitation With a Randomized Controlled Trial (Validación de Una Interfaz Cerebro-Computadora Para Rehabilitación Neurológica Por Medio de un Ensayo Clínico Controlado y Aleatorizado)

collaborators.name: National Council of Science and Technology, Mexico
Hospital General Dr. Manuel Gea González
El Instituto Nacional de Neurologia y Neurocirugia Manuel Velasco Suarez

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The study's main goal is to determine if clinical and physiological effects of a brain-computer interface intervention for the neurorehabilitation of stroke patients' upper limb are greater than the effects of a sham robotic feedback. For this purpose a randomized controlled trial will be performed to compare somatosensory sham robotic feedback with the same somatosensory feedback controlled with the brain-computer interface output.

armGroups.label: Sham Brain-Computer Interface controlled robotic feedback

interventions.name: Brain-Computer Interface
interventions.description: Passive hand movement will be provided to patients' paralyzed hand by means of a robotic hand orthosis that will be activated by the brain-computer interface based on hand movement intention.

interventions.name: Sham Brain-Computer Interface
interventions.description: Passive hand movement will be provided to patients' paralyzed hand by means of a robotic hand orthosis which activation will be independent of the output of the brain-computer interface based on hand movement intention.
armGroupLabels: Sham Brain-Computer Interface controlled robotic feedback

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in upper limb motor function on the Fugl-Meyer Assessment for the Upper Extremity
primaryOutcomes.description: Analysis of changes on the Fugl-Meyer Assessment for the Upper Extremity will reveal if there is a clinical significant sensorimotor function compared to baseline
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At enrollment, 3 weeks after the intervention onset, 6 weeks after the intervention onset, and 24 weeks after the intervention onset

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in upper limb motor function on the Action Research Arm Test
primaryOutcomes.description: Analysis of changes on the Action Research Arm Test will reveal if there is a clinical significant motor function compared to baseline
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At enrollment, 3 weeks after the intervention onset, 6 weeks after the intervention onset, and 24 weeks after the intervention onset

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in cortical activity measured with Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging
secondaryOutcomes.description: Blood-oxygen-level-dependent imaging will be analyzed to assess if there are changes in cortical activity compared to baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At enrollment, 3 weeks after the intervention onset, 6 weeks after the intervention onset, and 24 weeks after the intervention onset

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in corticospinal excitability measured with Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation
secondaryOutcomes.description: Motor Evoked Potentials parameters will reveal if there are changes of corticospinal excitability in both hemibodies compared to baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At enrollment, 3 weeks after the intervention onset, 6 weeks after the intervention onset, and 24 weeks after the intervention onset

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline in grip strength measured with a dynamometer
secondaryOutcomes.description: Analysis of hand strength measurements will reveal if there were changes compared to baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At enrollment, 3 weeks after the intervention onset, 6 weeks after the intervention onset, and 24 weeks after the intervention onset

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Clinical diagnosis of first ischemic stroke
* Time since stroke onset higher than 3 months and lower than 24 months
* Hand paresis
* Normal or corrected to normal vision
* Without previous diagnosed neurological diseases

Exclusion Criteria:

* Clinical diagnosis of severe aphasia
* Clinical diagnosis of severe depression
* Clinical diagnosis of severe attention deficits
* Previous diagnosis of traumatic brain injury
* Previous diagnosis of spinal cord injury
* Previous diagnosis of peripheral nerve injury
